186013767.review: Resident Evil 5 emerges as a bold, action-packed evolution of the survival horror franchise that transforms the series' traditional gameplay into a thrilling, cooperative experience set against the stunning backdrop of rural Africa. Chris Redfield and his partner Sheva Alomar deliver an intense narrative that explores bioweapon terrorism with cinematic flair, featuring jaw-dropping set pieces and some of the most memorable boss encounters in the series' history. While purists might critique the game's departure from pure horror, RE5 compensates with exceptional graphics, a compelling storyline that ties into the broader Resident Evil mythology, and a gameplay system that emphasizes strategic cooperation and resource management. The introduction of the Las Plagas parasite adds a fascinating twist to enemy design, creating more intelligent and dynamic threats that keep players constantly engaged and on edge. Despite its shift towards action, the game maintains the series' signature tension through meticulously crafted environments, an atmospheric soundtrack, and challenging combat scenarios that require careful planning and precise execution. Resident Evil 5 ultimately succeeds as a high-octane adventure that bridges the gap between survival horror and action, offering players an unforgettable journey that expands the franchise's narrative and gameplay boundaries.

Свого часу проходив самотужки і гра сподобалась набагато менше ніж четвірка. Цього разу грав у коопі і вона розкрилась по іншому, набагато краще.
+ Кооп режим. У грі присутні різні взаємодії між напарниками та існує багато ділянок на локаціях, які створювались під командну роботу.
+ Доволі різноманітний геймплей, який грамотно змінюється між боями, дослідженнями, і вирішенням простих загадок.
+ Цікаві та різноманітні битви з босами.
+ Чудові моделі головних героїв. Їхні лицьові анімації виконані прекрасно (враховуючи 2009 рік).
+ Непоганий дизайн рівнів. Самі рівні невеликі, але досліджувати їх цікаво і корисно, адже ви завжди отримаєте винагороду.
+ Хороший звук.

+/- Гра трохи розгубила в плані атмосфери і хорор складової та змістила пріорітети у бік екшену.
+/- Керування, стрільба та інтерфейс можуть відчуватися дещо застарілими, але якщо ви знайомі з минулими частинами серії, тоді все буде звично.

Resident Evil 5 робить акцент та ключові елементи геймплею саме на кооперативному проходженні, у цьому режимі вона відчуває себе дуже добре.
Я оцінюю її за двома критеріями: 1) Проходження з ШІ напарником 7.5 / 10 ; 2) Спільне проходження з другом  8.5 / 10.

185834868.review:
Resident Evil 5 is a bold step forward in the franchise, blending the series' survival horror roots with a more action-oriented approach. 
While it retains some of the tension and atmosphere fans expect, the game’s shift in tone and gameplay mechanics divides opinions to this day.
On the positive side, the cooperative gameplay is a highlight. 
Whether playing with a friend or relying on AI, the dynamic between Chris Redfield and Sheva Alomar brings a fresh dimension to the series. 
Navigating through sun-soaked African landscapes, abandoned ruins, and nightmarish laboratories, the game offers varied environments that keep the experience visually engaging. 
The addition of upgraded melee mechanics and a refined inventory system also ensures a smoother, more fluid gameplay experience.
The action is undeniably thrilling, with set pieces that rival Hollywood blockbusters. 
The fight against the infected hordes and larger-than-life bosses is intense and satisfying, especially when working with a co-op partner. 
The game’s visuals, especially for its time, are stunning, with detailed character models and environments that immerse you in its world.
However, this shift toward action comes at a cost. 
Many fans felt the game strayed too far from the survival horror elements that defined earlier entries in the franchise. 
The scares are few and far between, and the heavier focus on gunplay diminishes the feeling of vulnerability that made the series so iconic! 
Additionally, the AI partner, while serviceable, can sometimes hinder progress with poor decision-making, making solo play less enjoyable.
The game’s portrayal of its African setting has also been a point of controversy, with critics noting uncomfortable cultural insensitivities in its depiction of infected villagers and certain narrative choices. 
While not intentional, it’s an aspect that detracts from the overall experience for some players, but not to me personally. 
In the end, Resident Evil 5 is a well-made, action-packed game that offers a fun and cooperative adventure. 
It may not deliver the chills of its predecessors, but for those open to its evolution, it’s an entertaining, if divisive, entry in the series.

185827114.review: Resident Evil 5 se ha desviado de las raíces de terror que caracterizaban a la saga. El final, se siente más como un desenlace de acción frenética que como una conclusión satisfactoria. La excesiva utilización de secuencias de combate y explosiones eclipsa los elementos de horror y tensión que eran fundamentales en los títulos anteriores. Además, la falta de un ambiente inquietante y la escasa atmósfera de miedo (que si tenia RE4) hacen que la experiencia se sienta más como un juego de acción genérico que una verdadera entrega de Resident Evil. En resumen, siento que este título sacrificó su esencia en favor de la adrenalina y desperdicio a personajes iconicos de la saga, por lo que recomendare el juego solo si deseas jugar la saga y en buena oferta.

185669285.review:
While I wouldn't call this game "Survival Horror" it does advance the "Action Horror" themes that made Resident Evil 4 so popular. Adding the Co-Op options makes this a fun game to play with a friend. We especially liked the couch co-op game play.

The feel of the game, buying and upgrading equipment, and the general fast pace of the game will all feel familiar to those that played RE4, and in most cases they took the best parts of RE4 and made them even better here. The game features enough combat variety and location variety to give it an "Epic" feeling. 

Those fans of the original games may find that the series is venturing a bit far from the terror and horror of those games and replaced that tension and feel of never having enough resources to survive with a fast paced shooter adventure. They wouldn't be wrong - but that doesn't mean the games are not fun to play.

185668828.review:
[b]Hey gamers, let’s talk about Resident Evil 5, a game that may not hit the horror highs of its predecessors but still brings plenty of fun to the table. Here’s why it’s worth checking out.[/b]
[list]
[*][b]A Shift in Tone: Resident Evil 5 is where the series leaned more into action than survival horror. It’s like trading creepy haunted mansions for adrenaline-pumping action sequences – not what some fans expected, but still entertaining in its own way.[/b]

[*][b]Co-Op Action Madness: This game truly shines in co-op mode. Whether you’re playing online or with a friend on the couch, blasting through hordes of enemies with a buddy adds a whole new level of fun. It’s like surviving the apocalypse with your best friend, what’s not to love?[/b]

[*][b]Stunning Visuals (For Its Time): Resident Evil 5 was a visual treat when it launched. The vibrant African setting is a nice change from the dark, claustrophobic spaces of earlier games. From sunny savannahs to creepy caves, the environments keep you hooked.[/b]

[*][b]Gameplay Evolution: Sure, it’s more action-heavy than the classic Resident Evil games, but it’s still fun. The gunplay feels solid, and managing your limited resources adds a layer of strategy. Plus, the inventory system keeps you on your toes.[/b]

[*][b]Memorable Moments: Resident Evil 5 is packed with iconic moments, from intense boss fights to that infamous boulder-punching scene. It’s like a rollercoaster of epic moments that stick with you long after you’ve finished the game.[/b]

[*][b]Controversy Aside: The game has had its fair share of criticism, from the tonal shift to some of its design choices, but it’s still a solid action game. It’s like that movie everyone loves to nitpick but secretly enjoys.[/b]

[*][b]A Love Letter to Fans: While it’s not perfect, Resident Evil 5 throws in nods to longtime fans with returning characters and connections to the series' lore. For die-hard RE fans, it’s like a reunion with old friends, even if they’ve changed a bit.[/b]
[/list]

[b]My Verdict says Resident Evil 5 might not be the scariest entry in the franchise, but it’s a thrilling action game with a co-op experience that’s hard to beat. If you’re looking for something fun to play with a friend or you’re a fan of the series, give this one a shot. It’s got just enough Resident Evil DNA to keep you hooked!"[/b]

185553513.review:
生化危机4和生化危机5让我感到了神作和普通作品的差距。
我认为生化危机系列有三点最重要的要素组成，分别是恐惧、探索和资源管理。
1.在恐惧部分，4代虽然大幅加强了动作要素，恐怖感下降了很多，但仍通过更低的fov、碍事莉更昏暗的场景以及剧情设置营造了初见时相当的恐怖感（如在开局里昂误入小屋，队友下线、村民暴起攻击再到村庄保卫战，半个小时左右的流程，让玩家有了疑惑，恐慌、孤独、紧张等各种负面情绪，但同时钟声后的戛然而止，以及碍事莉的线索又把玩家探索的欲望拉高），而5代，克里斯从一开始就是来执行反恐任务，BSAA和队友从一开始就在我们身边，更是为了联机体验，给玩家常备了一个能打枪的NPC；又比如在5代的矿洞场景，除了一段隧道，甚至都和在太阳下一样亮堂。
2.在探索部分，4代和5代同样采用了章节式的推进方式，不同的是4代仍区分了三个大场景（村庄、城堡和海岛），在游玩过程中也有部分场景需要你多次路过或者重复探索，5代则真的变成了章节，很多场景缺乏辨识度，过去的场景不再能回头，大部分场景也都是一条路走到黑，很少有分支岔路等，少了很多探索乐趣。
3.在资源管理部分，5代删除了商人，宝石镶嵌等系统，变成了章节开始前统一买卖改造，这也意味着玩家不再需要路线规划和对卖宝资源的管理；同时5代删除了手提箱，变成了两人9+9共18个格子，这可能是为了联机做的妥协，但确实不如4代手提箱系统有趣。

185533512.review:
Resident Evil 5 é um jogo onde você controla Chris Redfield e luta contra Majinis na África, com sua leal companheira Sheva Alomar.

O jogo em si não é tão ruim quanto dizem. Há diversas partes na história e na gameplay em que me senti imerso, o que me fez adorar esse jogo ainda mais. Além de ter sido o jogo que mais joguei da saga, é um dos meus favoritos pessoais. Eu adoro este jogo porque consegui criar uma conexão melhor com Chris, já que este é o único jogo em que ele aparece como personagem principal (sem contar o 1º Resident Evil), o que me deu uma visão mais clara de quem é Chris Redfield.

Eu já tinha visto ele em outros jogos antes de jogar este, como RE1, RE: Revelations e até mesmo o RE6 (lançado após o 5). Mas foi aqui que conheci a lenda Redfield, vi do que ele realmente é capaz.

Spoiler!
Capítulo 1
O capítulo 1 do jogo serve mais como uma espécie de introdução ao jogo e aos personagens principais, explicando quem somos e onde estamos. Também nos apresenta nossa nova parceira Sheva Alomar, da BSAA, a organização onde Chris trabalha agora, que luta contra BOWs no mundo todo. Lutamos contra diversos Majinis, conhecemos novos inimigos, como o Cephalo, e enfrentamos o primeiro boss, o Uroboros. Claramente, este capítulo é um primeiro contato com o mundo que estamos entrando.

Capítulo 2
Este capítulo serve mais para nos acostumarmos com a ambientação do jogo, mecânicas e afins (na minha opinião). Somos introduzidos a Josh Stone e sua equipe, que nos salvam de um ataque e mostram ser importantes para a história no futuro. Também encontramos um banco de dados com uma foto de Jill Valentine, protagonista de RE1 e RE3, e antiga parceira de Chris. Lutamos contra uma espécie de "El Gigante 2.0", usando metralhadoras em um veículo da BSAA, além de enfrentarmos Popokarimu, um morcego. Este último boss não é tão interessante assim.

Capítulo 3

Você brinca de barquinho.
Brinca de jangada.
Foge de pessoas que não gostam de barquinhos.
E brinca de barquinho de novo, desta vez com Josh.
Ah, e mata um boss irrelevante.

Capítulo 4
Facilmente o pior capítulo do jogo. Não agrega nada à gameplay além de te socar com tesouros até o talo...
Puzzles que nem deveriam ser chamados de puzzles, de tão podres e chatos. Você anda ao redor de um templo puxando cordas e guiando lasers para ativar um elevador... De novo: UM ELEVADOR! Num templo!

Se este capítulo não existisse, o jogo seria muito melhor. É a maior encheção de linguiça que já vi.

Capítulo 5
Ao contrário do anterior, este é um dos melhores capítulos do jogo, onde a imersão é mais forte. Na primeira parte, reencontramos uma variante de um dos melhores inimigos da franquia: o Licker. Também conhecemos o melhor inimigo do jogo, o Reaper (não tão famoso assim). Ele é difícil e tenebroso, podendo te matar com um único golpe se você bobear. Infelizmente, seu ponto fraco é óbvio, tornando-o fácil de derrotar.

Há também uma boss fight com três métodos diferentes para vencê-lo. Por fim, enfrentamos Wesker pela primeira vez, onde é revelado que Jill Valentine está viva e sendo controlada por ele. Lutamos contra os dois até Wesker fugir, deixando Jill, que é libertada do transe.

Capítulo 6 - Final
Neste capítulo:

Brincamos de barquinho grande.
Lutamos no escuro.
Lutamos no avião.
Sobrevivemos a um vulcão (com ferimentos mínimos).
E derrotamos Wesker dentro do vulcão.
O capítulo conta como nossos heróis derrotam Wesker e impedem seu plano de dominação mundial. Após várias lutas intensas, incluindo hordas de inimigos e Reapers, Wesker é finalmente derrotado.

A batalha final tem 4 partes, mas há formas rápidas de acabar com ele, como usando uma Magnum.

Conteúdo Extra

Lost in Nightmares
Conta como Jill foi dada como morta. Chris e Jill investigam a mansão de Spencer, um dos fundadores da Umbrella. A DLC é curta, chata e só se salva por momentos de tensão e nostalgia da mansão do RE original.

A Desperate Escape
Explica como Jill e Josh chegaram ao vulcão. É uma DLC muito bem feita, com momentos de alta pressão, mas a movimentação durante os bombardeios é frustrante. Fora isso, é excelente.

Considerações finais
Para mim, este jogo é julgado injustamente. Todas as reclamações sobre ele são iguais às de RE4, que é amado pela comunidade. Ambos têm mais ação do que terror. Eu adoro RE4, mas RE5 está no mesmo nível, com a diferença de que sua parceira não é uma criança burra, mas uma adulta burra.

Este jogo é uma obra de arte, mesmo que não tanto quanto RE4 clássico. Recomendo que jogue e tire suas próprias conclusões.

185528663.review:
Czy gra jest dobra? Jest. 
Czy przetrwała próbę czasu? Połowicznie. 
Czy jest straszna? Ani trochę. 
Czy ci się spodoba? Zależy.

Osobiście grę pokochałem za replayability - grę warto przechodzić wielokrotnie celem ciągłego ulepszania ekwipunku. Czy ulepszenia są sensowne? Ani trochę, nie widzę możliwości noszenia pistoletu z magazynkiem na 100 pocisków czy pistoletu maszynowego z magazynkiem na 260 pocisków. Albo dwukrotne zwiększenie obrażeń. Czy to przeszkadza? Mi nie, sprawia za to olbrzymią satysfakcję.

Fabularnie gra jest płytka, głupia i naiwna. Ale kto gra w Residenty dla fabuły? To gry dla klimatu. Dla horroru... No nie no. Nie wyobrażam sobie nikogo starszego niż 7 lat kto mógłby się bać tej gry. Niemal cała gra dzieje się za dnia, walczymy głównie z ludźmi, czasem z nietoperzami i psami, jedynie bossowie są bardziej kreatywni.

Czy gra się w to dobrze? I tak, i nie. Nie rozumiem ograniczenia w poruszaniu się i celowaniu. Fajnie że można grać w coopa na jednym sprzęcie ale ekran jest pomniejszany i sterując padem masz celownik laserowy który jest praktycznie niewidoczny. Jednakże grając w pojedynkę, na myszce i ignorując drętwotę komputerowej Shevy można dobrze się bawić. Takie bieda Call of Duty. Takie pierwsze CoD, nie te nowe - im bliżej do Serious Sama.

Innymi słowy - jeśli nie jesteś fanem horroru jest bardzo duża szansa że gra ci się spodoba. Jeśli od Residenta oczekujesz horroru to polecam przeskoczyć do 7ki.

185515051.review:
Resident Evil 5 divide opiniões mas eu acho que é um jogo mediano. O primeiro da franquia principal a ter um modo coop, o que torna o jogo MUITO divertido com amigos, mas que contribui também pra matar o terror do game.

Gráficos: 7/10 até que são bonitos, visto a época em que foi lançado.
Jogabilidade: 7/10 poucos problemas, só tá meio datado, tu leva um tempinho pra acostumar.
bugs: Não vi nenhum expressivo.

A ambientação do game também não é lá das melhores, apesar de tudo, o jogo é divertido se tu tiver um amigo do lado (Jogar sozinho deve ser um terror, visto que a IA da sua parceira é burra como uma porta). Os bosses e os inimigos são ctrl c + ctrl v do Resident Evil 4, só que africanos.

Quero deixar um espaço pra falar da dlc "Lost Nightmares", a DLC que mostra como esse game tinha potencial pra retornar ao que era na primeira trilogia. Poucos inimigos, mas recursos escassos, onde você tem que pensar pra resolver cada puzzle, muitas vezes com um inimigo atrás de você que se te pega é HK. Esse modo eu me diverti mais do que a campanha inteira. Mais terror, mais desafiador e por consequência mais divertido. Isso me deixa triste pq mostra o potencial enorme que esse game tinha. Vamo ver quando sair um Remake, que direção eles vão tomar.

185412452.review: I think the game is great and worth playing, but maybe I just can't get enough Resident Evil. I've been a massive fan of the series ever since I sat on the couch and watched my parents play this game with split screen co-op on PS3. And now having played through the game myself multiple times, I think I'll have to give it a 6.5/10. Enemy and mission design can feel really stale and the game does have massive difficulty spikes and makes some mechanics in boss fights unclear. Gameplay with tank controls definitely feels outdated at times but keeps the tension. Sheva's AI is dumb, and you have to feed your partner ammo and healing, unlike RE6. So definitely play it with a friend; it makes everything funnier, as this definitely is a meme game at times. Cinematics can be masterclass, Wesker is really cool at times, Chris' muscles are definitely not natural, and the QTEs are stupid but hilarious. I do commend the devs for making death animations for each section of those quick time events though. Me and my friends died on purpose to see the goofy anims.

185405103.review:
Não recomendo este jogo para fãs de Resident Evil. Ele é muito diferente dos jogos anteriores, tenta copiar o Resident Evil 4, mas acaba destacando as piores características desse jogo, falhando em reproduzir os acertos do RE4. No entanto, julgando-o apenas como um jogo independente, sem considerá-lo parte da franquia Resident Evil, ele se torna medíocre, mas ainda assim divertido, especialmente se você jogar com um amigo.

Coisas que não gostei no jogo:
- O inventário é muito limitado e não permite upgrades para aumentar o tamanho. É ridículo ter apenas 9 espaços (18 contando com os da Sheva, mas é extremamente inconveniente gerenciar o inventário dela ao mesmo tempo).
- O jogo foca muito em "zonas de luta". É como se todo o jogo fosse composto por corredores e salas repletos de hordas de inimigos. Imagine se, no Resident Evil 4, cada nova parte fosse como uma "vila" com inimigos surgindo incessantemente até que você ativasse algum gatilho. O Resident Evil 5 segue exatamente essa fórmula.
- A inteligência artificial da ajudante é muito ruim. Não tive tantos problemas quanto já vi em alguns vídeos, mas enfrentei dificuldades. Certos tipos de armas, como granadas e minas, a Sheva simplesmente não consegue usar. Mesmo que ela não tenha munição de outro tipo, não utilizará, por exemplo, um lança-granadas (isso aconteceu comigo — não sei se é um bug ou algo intencional).
- O jogo é separado em "fases". Você pode pensar: "Mas o Resident Evil 4 também é". Porém, no caso do RE5, além de você não conseguir explorar o mapa como se fosse um único ambiente, itens deixados para trás em uma sala desaparecem assim que você avança para o próximo capítulo. É literalmente o jogo carregando uma nova fase.
- A exploração é muito fraca. O mapa é pequeno e linear, geralmente com apenas um caminho a seguir.
- Não há puzzles no jogo. Os puzzles do Resident Evil 4 já eram bem simples, mas no RE5 eles praticamente não existem. O mais próximo de um puzzle aparece no final do jogo: você precisa atirar em um botão para levantar uma plataforma quando a Sheva estiver em cima, e vice-versa. Porém, são coisas extremamente básicas.
- O sistema de loja é mal planejado. Como o jogo é dividido em fases, toda vez que você termina uma fase ou morre, surge uma oportunidade de comprar itens na loja, melhorar seus equipamentos, etc. Isso significa que não há um "mercador" no jogo, e o sistema fica sem sentido. Isso poderia ser facilmente resolvido se, em vez de dinheiro, você recolhesse "peças" que o próprio Chris (ou Sheva) usaria para melhorar as armas, como em The Last of Us. Outra solução seria adicionar um mercador no início de cada capítulo.
- Muita reciclagem de inimigos e mecânicas do Resident Evil 4.
- Algumas coisas são simplesmente inconvenientes, como o inventário não pausar o jogo ou o fato de o personagem não girar no próprio eixo, a menos que você segure X ou A.
Coisas boas no jogo:
- O sistema cooperativo é interessante e tem potencial, algo que foi melhorado no Resident Evil 6. Como já mencionei, o jogo é muito mais divertido jogando com outra pessoa.
- O arsenal é grande. Praticamente em todo capítulo você encontra uma arma nova.
- Há um fator replay interessante, já que você pode escolher capítulos para jogar novamente e tentar alcançar o rank S.
- Além de ser extenso, o arsenal também é variado, incluindo armas melee, lança-granadas, rifles de precisão, magnums, metralhadoras e shotguns.
Resumo
O jogo apresenta muito mais falhas do que pontos positivos, mas, sob certas condições, ele pode ser divertido. Com um mod para aumentar o tamanho do inventário e melhorar a IA da Sheva (ainda recomendo jogar com outra pessoa), a experiência pode ser melhor. No entanto, em seu estado original, não posso recomendá-lo.

185400989.review:
Let me set the record straight: Albert Wesker is not the villain of Resident Evil 5. He’s a visionary, a pioneer, a man ahead of his time who dared to dream of a better world. Sure, the game wants you to believe he’s evil, but when you look at the facts, it becomes clear that Wesker is the real hero—and Chris Redfield, with his boulder-punching antics, is the true menace.

Here’s why Wesker is innocent and why Resident Evil 5 is actually a tragic tale of betrayal:

1. Wesker’s Vision Was Noble
Wesker wasn’t some cackling cartoon villain bent on destruction. He genuinely believed in creating a world free of weakness, disease, and imperfection. Sure, his methods were unconventional (okay, maybe very unconventional), but can you name a great visionary who didn’t have critics? He sought to push humanity to its next stage of evolution, which sounds a lot better than Chris’s plan of maintaining the status quo.

2. Chris Is the Real Aggressor
Let’s talk about Chris Redfield. This guy spends the entire game hunting Wesker across the globe like some obsessed maniac. Does he stop to ask why Wesker is doing what he’s doing? No. Does he consider the possibility that Wesker’s plans might actually benefit humanity? Of course not. Instead, Chris uses brute force to shut down Wesker’s ambitions, destroying valuable research and punching boulders like a lunatic in the process.

3. Wesker Was Constantly Betrayed
Wesker’s journey is one of constant betrayal and mistrust. Umbrella used him, the BSAA vilified him, and even his so-called allies doubted him. Despite all this, he persevered, driven by his unshakable belief in his vision for a better world. Meanwhile, Chris and his allies are little more than pawns of the same corrupt institutions that perpetuate the very problems Wesker sought to solve.

4. A Mastermind, Not a Monster
Wesker’s intelligence and resourcefulness are unmatched. He’s not some mindless brute like Nemesis or a walking bioweapon like the Tyrants—he’s a strategic genius with a plan. The T-Virus? The Uroboros project? These weren’t just weapons; they were tools for reshaping humanity into something stronger, better, and more resilient. If that makes him a "villain," then perhaps we need to rethink what we consider villainy.

5. Chris and Sheva: Destroyers of Progress
What do Chris and Sheva accomplish in Resident Evil 5? They blow up labs, kill researchers, and destroy years of scientific advancement. Wesker wasn’t trying to destroy the world—he was trying to save it. Chris, on the other hand, acts like a blunt instrument of chaos, incapable of seeing the bigger picture. The real tragedy of Resident Evil 5 is that Wesker’s vision dies, snuffed out by people too shortsighted to see its brilliance.

Albert Wesker wasn’t evil—he was simply too ambitious for a world that feared change. His dream of an evolved humanity was ahead of its time, and Resident Evil 5 is a testament to what happens when visionaries are crushed by the very systems they seek to improve.

Chris Redfield, meanwhile, is the real villain: a muscle-bound lackey who punches first and thinks never. His actions don’t save the world; they doom it to mediocrity.

5/5 – A tragic masterpiece of misunderstood genius and the lengths to which the mediocre will go to preserve their small, fragile world. Rest in power, Wesker. You deserved better.

185155946.review:
Es muy buen juego con sus pros y sus contras, que se siente como un reciclaje de su antecesor, el cual dejó la vara muy alta para las nuevas entregas. En jugabilidad es igual, con un poco más de acción y enemigos que se ven idénticos al anterior. En esta ocasión tenemos un inventario más reducido como fue en los originales, lo cual cumple la función de ser más estrategas, pero con escasez de hierbas y munición de vez en cuando. Algo nuevo es que tenemos a nuestra compañera que nos acompañará durante toda la historia, está hecho para poder jugarse en modo cooperativo y si no tienes con quién jugar, puede ser un poco fastidioso tener que hacerlo con un npc. 

En cuanto a la historia me encanta porque vuelven los originales: Chris y Jill con Wesker como antagonista, lo cual es épico. Conocemos a un nuevo personaje quien es nuestra compañera: Sheva, a quien en un futuro remake deberían darle un poco más de profundidad y enseñarnos más sobre su pasado o quién es ella y qué hizo luego de los hechos transcurridos en esta entrega. 

Si no me equivoco es el más vendido de toda la saga y con razón, es excelente aunque tenga sus tantas contras. Espero con ansias un remake.

185022283.review:
Resident Evil 5 to odsłona, która stawia na dynamiczną akcję i współpracę w trybie kooperacji, ale w dużej mierze rezygnuje z elementów klasycznego survival horroru, z którego znana była seria. Gra przenosi nas do słonecznej Afryki, gdzie Chris Redfield i Sheva Alomar muszą zmierzyć się z nowym zagrożeniem bioterrorystycznym.

Pod względem rozgrywki Resident Evil 5 oferuje solidną strzelankę z elementami taktyki. System kooperacji jest dużym atutem – grając z drugim graczem, współpraca dostarcza sporo frajdy. Niestety, sterowanie i sztuczna inteligencja Shevy w trybie jednoosobowym pozostawiają sporo do życzenia, co potrafi frustrować.

Fabularnie Resident Evil 5 mocno wpisuje się w wątki znane z wcześniejszych części, ale brakuje jej elementu zaskoczenia i głębszego klimatu. Lokacje, choć różnorodne, nie zawsze budują napięcie, a przeciwnicy są bardziej efekciarscy niż przerażający.

Oprawa graficzna, zwłaszcza jak na swój czas, robi wrażenie – gra wygląda bardzo dobrze, a efekty świetlne i szczegóły otoczenia cieszą oko. Muzyka dobrze wspiera akcję, choć nie zapada w pamięć tak, jak w starszych odsłonach.

Podsumowując, Resident Evil 5 to solidna gra akcji, która bardziej przypadnie do gustu fanom dynamicznej rozgrywki niż miłośnikom klasycznego horroru. Nie jest to najlepsza odsłona serii, ale w trybie kooperacji potrafi dostarczyć wielu godzin dobrej zabawy. Jeśli szukasz intensywnej akcji z lekkim dreszczykiem, warto dać jej szansę – zwłaszcza na promocji.

184817379.review:
there's this mini-boss fight in chapter 5-2 i would like to discuss because it changed my life. so, my friend and i arrived with stars in our eyes. sure, things had been difficult thus far, but it was nothing we couldn't handle. yes, we're playing on easy mode, and no, we're not ashamed. the beginning of the fight started normally. we came prepared: ammo, heals--anything we knew we'd need. but this fight was taking much longer than either of us could've anticipated; my friend has played the game before, but it was on console many years ago. we didn't let this deter us; we trekked onward, easily burning through our supplies. the game felt bad for a few minutes and gave us some rifle ammo--neither of us had a rifle--but it quickly stopped spawning anything else. we were still hopeful at this point. oh, how naive the two of us were.

by the time we'd reached the fifteen minute mark or so, we'd used all our heals and ammo; we had to tread very carefully. things could get dark really fast... we had to wait for a flamethrower to charge up, which was our only weapon. we must've used that thing at least 20 times. we knew it was meant to be difficult, but for god's sake we were on easy mode. both of us figured something was wrong. so, my friend took a moment to hide in the corner to google what was up. apparently, the fight was bugged on steam and doesn't show the boss's weak spots. the solution? a rocket launcher. but we didn't have a rocket launcher, and we'd spent too long on it this time to give up now. the only thing stopping us at this point was DEATH. so what was our other option? hit it a billion times with the flamethrower. and so we did.

there were no signs of change. the reaction was the same each time we attacked the mighty beast with our hellfire. with every attempt we thought, "surely, this has to be the last time," but it never was. by the halfway point, the only thing keeping me sane was shooting at the thing with imaginary bullets. the noise of the empty gun made me feel something that i had long lost by this point. the sound became comforting to me during that dark time, and i will forever be grateful. 

it seemed like nothing was working... were we going to have to restart the level to fix the bugs? no. we had to keep going. we had no other choice.

and then, when all hope seemed to be lost, a light began to beckon me. just kidding, but it was over. oh my god... it was finally over. i started crying. HAPPY TEARS. i was sweating; my whole body ached from this onerous hellscape of a battle. we'd spent an hour on the chapter, and i'd never been so happy to see that ending screen. my friend then proceeded to send me a video from fifteen years ago of someone completing the fight in 2 1/2 minutes, and you know what, it ached a little bit. but then, i remembered something. this person probably didn't think twice about beating this level, but for me, it was a triumph. never in my life have i felt this overcome with emotion after doing anything in a video game. and i likely will never feel that  again. an hour of my life spent doing this inconsequential fight that will never matter... but i learned what it means to persevere, to never give up, even when things don't get better.

i know if we'd brought that rocket launcher, this lesson would've never been learned. we needed to wait for that godforsaken flamethrower to charge twenty something times. we learned what sacrifice meant when the person with more health chose to carry the flamethrower's burden. we were beaten down countless times to our breaking point. and guess what? it all paid off.

if you decide to buy this game, i beg of you: just please remember this one thing.

bring the fucking rocket launcher.

[h1] Resident Evil 5 [/h1]

 RE V to kolejna produkcja od capcomu z serii rezydencja zła. W tej odsłonie trafiamy do afryki, gdzie umbrella wypuściła wirusa. Oczywiście tam gdzie wirus, tam też osoby walczące z nim, próbujące powstrzymać całą tą zarazę. Wśród nich pojawia się Chris Redfield, bohater, którego możemy kojarzyć z pierwszej odsłony. Do pomocy z bioterroryzmem umbrelli Krystianek ma nową bohaterkę, jaką jest Sheva Alomar. 
 Podczas rozgrywki mamy do czynienia z wieloma rodzajami przeciwników, począwszy od mutantów po zwykłe odmiany zainfekowanych wirusem majinów. Zazwyczaj każdy rozdział kończy się walką z bossem.
Wybór broni jest spory, gracz może dysponować pistoletem, karabinem, rakietnicą, a co najważniejsze elektryczną pałą. 
 Z ważniejszych aspektów re5 jest to, że gra daje możliwość zagrania z towarzyszem, gdzie każdy dysponuje osobnym ekwipunkiem i może wspomagać sojusznika, czy to ubezpieczaniem, czy też reanimacją i leczeniem.
 Podsumowując Resident Evil 5 umożliwia nam wejście w niekrótką historię, w której pojawiają się nie lada wyzwania. Występują różnorakie lokacje, począwszy od slamsów afrykańskich, bagno po wulkan. Resident Evil 5 is a thrilling action-horror game that delivers an enjoyable experience, though it doesn’t quite reach the heights of its predecessor, Resident Evil 4, which I hold in higher regard at 9/10. The game offers solid gameplay with satisfying combat mechanics and a good blend of action and exploration. One of its standout features is the co-op mode, which makes the experience significantly more enjoyable when played with a friend. The story, while not groundbreaking, is engaging enough and ties neatly into the broader Resident Evil universe. The environments are atmospheric and well-designed, effectively capturing the tension and dread that fans expect from the series.  

However, Resident Evil 5 has its share of shortcomings. The inventory system, for one, feels clunky and restrictive, making item management during intense moments unnecessarily frustrating. This issue becomes more pronounced in co-op, where sharing inventory between players feels cumbersome. The AI-controlled partner, Sheva, also leaves much to be desired. While her presence is crucial for gameplay mechanics, her tendency to waste precious ammo, interfere with aim, and mismanage resources can be incredibly frustrating for solo players. As a result, I often resorted to limiting her inventory and relegating her to tasks like holding items—a decision that felt both amusing and mildly exasperating.  

Despite these drawbacks, Resident Evil 5 remains a fun and memorable entry in the franchise. The gameplay is exciting, the settings are immersive, and the addition of co-op adds a unique layer of camaraderie. The DLCs, though short, are enjoyable side content that further enrich the experience. While it doesn’t capture the same magic as Resident Evil 4, it’s still a game I’m glad to have played, earning a well-deserved 8/10. While I don’t see myself revisiting it anytime soon, the journey through its action-packed campaign was absolutely worth it.

Évaluation : 🌟🌟🌟🌟 (4/5)
"Resident Evil 5 – L’horreur en duo, dans une ambiance explosive."

Resident Evil 5, développé par Capcom, marque un virage vers l’action tout en conservant quelques racines d’horreur. Avec sa campagne en coopération, son intrigue captivante et des graphismes impressionnants pour son époque, le jeu offre une expérience intense et mémorable.

Les Points Forts :
✅ Une coopération solide :
Jouer à deux en écran partagé ou en ligne est l’une des meilleures façons de profiter du jeu. La collaboration entre Chris et Sheva est au cœur de l’expérience, rendant chaque combat stratégique et engageant.

✅ Des graphismes impressionnants (pour l'époque) :
Même aujourd’hui, les environnements, qu’il s’agisse des villages africains ou des installations industrielles, restent visuellement attrayants grâce à leur direction artistique.

✅ Un arsenal varié :
Du pistolet au lance-roquettes, chaque arme offre une sensation unique et satisfaisante. La possibilité d'améliorer et de personnaliser l'équipement ajoute une profondeur stratégique.

✅ Un rythme intense :
Resident Evil 5 ne vous laisse aucun répit, alternant entre combats acharnés, poursuites spectaculaires et moments de tension.

✅ Un lore enrichi :
Pour les fans de la saga, le jeu approfondit l’histoire de Chris Redfield et sa rivalité avec Albert Wesker. La conclusion dramatique de leur affrontement est un moment mémorable pour la franchise.

✅ Modes bonus attrayants :
Le mode "Mercenaries" prolonge la durée de vie du jeu avec des défis chronométrés excitants, parfaits pour les amateurs de scoring.

Les Points Faibles :
⚠️ Une orientation vers l’action qui divise :
Pour les puristes de l’horreur, le virage vers une expérience plus axée sur le tir peut sembler éloigné de l’essence de Resident Evil.

⚠️ Une IA de coéquipier limitée :
Si vous jouez en solo, l’IA de Sheva peut parfois poser problème, notamment dans la gestion des ressources ou lors de combats exigeants.

⚠️ Un gameplay rigide :
Le système de contrôle, notamment l’impossibilité de se déplacer tout en visant, peut frustrer les nouveaux joueurs habitués aux standards modernes.

⚠️ Un scénario prévisible :
Bien qu’il enrichisse le lore, l’histoire reste assez classique, avec des rebondissements attendus et des clichés de films d’action.

En conclusion :
Resident Evil 5 est une expérience unique dans la franchise, qui mélange action explosive et coopération intense. Bien qu’il s’éloigne de l’horreur pure qui a fait le succès des premiers jeux, il brille par son rythme effréné et son gameplay engageant, surtout en multijoueur. Si vous cherchez un jeu d’action avec une pointe de survie, RE5 est un excellent choix.

🎮 Verdict final :
Un épisode charnière qui privilégie l’action au détriment de l’horreur, mais qui reste diablement divertissant, surtout à deux.

⏳ Temps de jeu recommandé :

Campagne principale : 10 à 12 heures.
Modes bonus et complétion : 20+ heures.
✨ Note personnelle : Une aventure explosive où la coopération est la clé pour triompher de la menace bioterroriste.

De loin, le plus mauvais des RE!
Pour une fois l'histoire n'est pas en amérique, cela change. Cependant, l'histoire est molle, il n'y a pas grand chose qui est raconté dans cet opus. Les énigmes sont d'un basique quand elles existent, pour le reste, il s'agit simplement d'un jeu d'action/aventure sans le côté horreur si important de la série des RE.
Pour ma part j'ai fait deux fois le jeu en coop et je le recommande uniquement dans cette optique.
Concernant les contrôles, il s'agit de ceux de l'époque, il faudra donc s'y faire (on s'y habitue rapidement).
Pour les menus, ce n'est pas du tout intuitif. Rien que lancer une coop local relève déjà d'une énigme digne de ce nom! Il faut lancer le jeu en solo, bien mettre le paramètre de partie en local et une fois en jeu il faut faire pause et le deuxième joueur doit ensuite appuyer sur échappe pour recréer la partie en coop local. Je ne parle même pas de la traduction des menus et inventaire qui est médiocre! Récupérer un objet de l'inventaire c'est "organiser" et des comme ça il y en a plein d'autres!
Lors du dernier combat contre Wesker, nous avons perdu énormément de temps à comprendre ce qu'il fallait faire car nous déclenchions certains évènements avant de faire certaines actions
Pour moi ce jeu ne mérite pas des évaluations extrêmement positives mais seulement positives voir moyennes avec des mises en gardes concernant les problèmes du jeu pour éviter à certains d'être déçu en lançant le jeu.

hola a todos!!!

En lo personal le tengo mucho cariño a este juego es de los primeros juegos que tuve la oportunidad de probar en mi vida y me llena de recuerdos.

Este juego me inició en la saga y ha sido una parte de mi vida desde entonces, este juego genero mucha polémica entre los fanáticos de la saga, sin embargo tiene muchas cualidades.

Este juego tiene la experiencia cooperativa definitiva de la saga, nos hace conocer mucho más de la historia de umbrella y la creación de los virus, buenos modos extras, sus dlc's son excelentes y atan los cabos que quedan sueltos, buenas peleas de jefes, diseños de niveles y dificultad (aunque esto a veces lo dudo por el modo profesional en solitario).

Claro que hay algunos problemas, el más grande es la inteligencia artificial de nuestra compañera lo que a veces hace algo complicado jugarlo en solitario, pero no es imposible, he logrado pasar todos los modos en la máxima dificultad en solitario. Otro punto que puede llegar a ser negativo son pequeñas partes de la pelea final y de como termina el villano principal de la saga, no diré más por si alguien que lee esto no ha jugado los juegos. Y para algunas personas puede llegar a ser frustrante el modo versus sobre todo por lo complicado que es encontrar partida ahora.

Se que resident evil 4 es un gran juego y uno que me encanta también sin embargo este juego es mi favorito de la segunda trilogía numerada.

Definitivamente merece que le des una oportunidad.

184173135.review:
Este juego jamás debería haber visto la luz del día. Solo destaca por la calidad de imagen y que, en definitiva, es entretenido jugarlo. Por lo demás (jugabilidad, historia, mecánicas, inventario, escenarios, etc.), es un despropósito: el RE5 solo destaca por las burdas copias y recicladas que hace del RE4. No es de recibo la poca diferencia que hay entre estas dos entregas, una de 2005 y otra de 2009, y esa poca diferencia, en general, ha sido a peor. No es un RE4 con esteroides, es un RE4 artificioso y cutre. Solo han mejorado la gestión de objetos (fuera del inventario), el modo Mercenarios (solo han añadido más escenarios y personajes) y una biblioteca de extras para comprar y coleccionar, pero son cambios mínimos en comparación a lo reciclado y empeorado. Si no se llamase Resident Evil 5, no habría trascendido Japón.

No sé si aporta algo a la saga en los archivos distribuidos por la campaña, que por supuesto no he leído porque la historia debe contarse durante la campaña y complementarse en lecturas, no al revés. Es tan malo que hace gracia, al menos las 2 o 3 primeras veces que te lo pasas. De resto, si te lo tomas como un juego menor y no como una entrega principal y te vale solo con pegar tiros y mejorar armas, es un juego entretenido. Eso será suficiente para no considerar haber perdido tu dinero por comprarlo. Este es un buen ejemplo: los quick-time events son tan sumamente malos que en la versión Steam se han retirado mayoritariamente, con lo cual se ven escenas extrañas.

Si estaba planteado para ser cooperativo, deberían comercializarlo en esa especialidad: jugar "solo" en pro puede ser un completo suplicio en gran parte debido al comportamiento tosco y engorroso del compañero. Por último, hay una cantidad desmedida de logros, de los cuales al menos 9 están basados en jugar partidas online, imposibles de conseguir debido a que nadie juega ya a este émulo del RE4, así que ni siquiera tendrás la recompensa de ver el juego al 100% en tu cuenta de Steam.

SPOILER ALERT: no había peor juego para dar fin al principal villano de la saga y una de sus insignias. Cuando se hable de RE5 será exclusivamente por eso, porque nada más aporta. Ni un solo personaje mínimamente memorable, aunque algunos diseños y la ambientación gráfica en general son bastante buenos y detallados.

[b]Плюсы:[/b]
[list]
    [*]Кооперативный режим. Возможность играть в команде с другом добавляет новый уровень взаимодействия и стратегии, делая игру более увлекательной.
    [*]Улучшенная графика и звук. Графика стала более детализированной, а звук — качественным, что создаёт атмосферу ужаса и напряжения.
    [*]Разнообразие врагов. В игре представлено множество разнообразных врагов, каждый из которых имеет свои особенности и требует особого подхода.
    [*]Интересный сюжет. Хотя сюжет может показаться сложным и запутанным, он всё же интересен и увлекателен. Игроки могут узнать больше о мире Resident Evil и его обитателях.
    [*]Атмосфера. Несмотря на некоторые недостатки, игра всё же создаёт атмосферу ужаса и напряжения, которая характерна для серии Resident Evil.
[/list]
[b]Минусы:[/b]
[list]
    [*]Сложность управления. Некоторые игроки могут столкнуться с проблемами при управлении персонажами, особенно в боевых сценах.
    [*]Баги и ошибки. Иногда в игре могут возникать баги и ошибки, которые могут испортить впечатление от игры.
    [*]Однообразие некоторых локаций. Некоторые локации в игре могут показаться однообразными и скучными.
    [*]Проблемы с балансом. Некоторые способности и оружие могут быть слишком мощными или бесполезными, что может повлиять на баланс игры.
    [*]Высокая сложность. Некоторые миссии могут быть очень сложными и требовать много времени и усилий для прохождения.
[/list]

184005762.review:
i dont think this game is very enjoyable unless ur unhealthily in love with wesker

i found that the wasted potential was just super depressing

re5 shouldve been a supernova. it shouldve been emotional. multiple games leading up to this final confrontation between chris and wesker. but... i just dont feel anything. here are some of the plot elements i took issue with:

- as the player, i barely feel any emotional connection to chris losing jill. i do feel bad for him, but its just... not enough. they dont show enough emotion. his partner and really close friend sacrificed herself for him. not to mention, saving him from their OLD BOSS killing him. this is a big deal. but theres just... barely any emotion

- the storywriting between chris and wesker is just so awful. ofc theres been some time since re1 and jill beding snatched, but that doesnt excuse the complete lack of emotional responses from chris. he once admired and looked up to wesker. now he has to grapple with the respect he once felt, and the anger and disappointment he must feel for all of weskers immoral actions. and yet, they portray chris as not giving a rats ass. casually meeting and killing wesker like its nothing. thats not how humans work. i get the feeling they wanted to make chris somewhat funny and badass akin to leon in og4, but this situation is a stupid time to do it. leon has an actual personality. he is memorable as a person. chris feels like a placeholder character for the player. thats not what i want. i want to play as *chris* living through these events

- sheva is just... there? theres just no emotional connection to her at all. i want better progress of her relationship with chris, and more emphasis on how her past has lead her to this point. its like she barely even exists as a person. shes just a placeholder. her only noteworthy moment is continuously calling wesker mentally unwell (which he is)

- dont even get me started on whichever alien claims to be chris redfield in this game. does not look like re1 chris, which is a crime against humanity. he has little to no personality. no emotional connection with anyone, except sliiiightly with jill. on steroids. this chris simply does not exist to me.

for gameplay issues, the movement and camera somehow managed to feel worse than in og4. the combat isnt great. the bosses, except wesker, arent very fun

in summary, its not a *bad* game, its just that the wasted potential is right in your fucking face, which just makes the experience depressing. unless wesker is your pookie, or you have a really hilarious friend, there is really no need to play this game. it doesnt mean that playing it is particularly unenjoyable, it just means... theres not really any incentive to play it. its not fun or interesting enough to warrant the money and time spent on it

183889570.review:
Resident Evil 5 era um jogo que... honestamente bicho, EU ESNOBAVA PRA CARALHO, eu sempre pensava que seria um LIXO absurdo e toda oportunidade que eu tinha eu fugia desse jogo.

Mas cara, jogando agora pela primeira vez... não é que o bagulho é bom? Eu prefiro um bilhão de vezes o estilo mais terror classico, mas RE5 mantem o survival horror que a gente viu no RE4 original mas trazendo mais pra uma pegada filme de zumbi americano. Enquanto RE4 original mesmo sendo ação ainda era bem cabreiro, o 5 faz um terror mais parecido com aqueles filmes de zumbis que são mais tensos do que exatamente assustadores, 2050 inimigos correndo atrás dos protagonistas igual eu corro do imposto de renda.

O jogo é bem mais linear do que o RE4, o que me deixa triste MAS não me incomoda tanto nesse jogo. Dito isso, acho que gostei muito dele porque minha primeira experiencia foi em CO-OP. Sério TUDO NESSE JOGO foi feito pra se jogar em multiplayer, eu imagino como que deve ser jogar isso em single com uma IA toda fudida nossa senhora deve literalmente matar o jogo.

Boa parte da magia dele é jogar do inicio ao fim em Co-Op aproveitando todas as gimmicks que o jogo apresenta envolvendo o seu amigo, o que é simplesmente do caralho.

Sinto que o Remake tem como deixar esse jogo perfeito, minha expectativa realista é eles deixarem a gameplay melhor, mas o que eu queria mesmo é o nivel de tratamento que deram pro RE4 remake, deixando mais exploravel e com um tom bem mais terror do que o original.

183777370.review:
[i]“Плече до плеча, друже! Удвох і зомбі не страшні!”[/i]

[b]Рецензія на Resident Evil 5[/b]

[b]Графіка:[/b]

Resident Evil 5 (2009) зробила великий крок уперед у плані графіки порівняно з попередніми частинами серії. Африканські локації, освітлення і детально промальовані моделі персонажів виглядають чудово навіть за сучасними стандартами. Особливо вражають спецефекти, такі як тіні і відблиски, які підсилюють атмосферу.

[b]Геймплей:[/b]

Гра робить акцент на кооперативному проходженні, і це її головна перевага. Ви граєте за Кріса Редфілда або його напарницю Шеву Аломар, борючись із хвилями зомбі та мутантів у різних регіонах Африки. Кооператив додає грі багато шарму, адже кожен персонаж має свої сильні сторони. Але керування інвентарем у реальному часі може створювати незручності, особливо під час напружених моментів.

Бойова система ближча до екшену, ніж до хорору: велика кількість боєприпасів і динамічні сутички з босами створюють відчуття, що гра менше лякає, ніж попередні частини. Для шанувальників старого Resident Evil це може здатися розчаруванням.

[b]Сюжет:[/b]

Події розгортаються після Resident Evil 4 і продовжують історію корпорації Umbrella та біозброї. Кріс і Шева розслідують біоатаку в Африці, що призводить до зіткнення зі старим ворогом Альбертом Вескером. Сюжет драматичний, але подекуди клішований.

[b]Музика та звук:[/b]

Саундтрек гармонійно підсилює атмосферу, додаючи напруги під час битв. Звуковий дизайн виконаний на високому рівні: звуки пострілів, гарчання мутантів і діалоги персонажів чудово передають дух гри.

[b]Недоліки:[/b]

Одноосібне проходження не приносить такого задоволення, як у кооперативі.

Брак напруги та страху, характерного для перших частин серії.

Сюжет іноді здається надто передбачуваним.

Керування може викликати дискомфорт у нових гравців.


[b]Оцінка:[/b]

Resident Evil 5 отримує 8/10. Це відмінний екшен із кооперативним режимом, але водночас дещо віддалений від традиційного хорору серії.

[b]Підсумок:[/b]

Resident Evil 5 є яскравою і захоплюючою пригодою, особливо якщо грати з другом. Це еволюція серії в бік динамічного екшену, яка пропонує цікаву історію, відмінний кооператив і видовищні битви. Однак для тих, хто шукає класичного жаху, гра може здатися недостатньо атмосферною.

183696630.review: fun game makes my balls itch

183681386.review: Tenho um carinho gigantesco por este game porque antigamente eu o jogava com amigos, o que me faz recordar de tempos mais simples e felizes. Jogar novamente foi uma explosão de nostalgia. A campanha principal é muito boa e a Gold Edition trouxe duas histórias extras que também são muito interessantes (Desperate Escape e Lost In Nightmares). Minhas únicas queixas são em relação à gameplay em si (tinha esquecido o QUÃO RUINS são os controles, o personagem joga de uma forma muito travada, sendo que a pior parte é ser forçado a atirar e recarregar parado) e ao meme do Chris socando uma pedra colossal (também havia esquecido o quão ridiculo e cômico isso foi, quebrando bastante a seriedade da história). Fora isso, dá pra se divertir. Vale a pena conferir!

183514292.review: I feel like this is one of the most underrated games in the RE: Franchise. Which I understand at times. But my experience with RE:5 has always been very positive (even if there were some bugs in Multi) I think it's saved by having CO-OP! Highly recommend playing it with a friend I was crying laughing half of the time. Things can be very strange and I think its a bad introduction to RE: but genuinely so fucking fun and funny at times! I think it would be even more fun if you and your friend are cowards who dont handle horror well! (Though its not scary at all to me at least)
